paper_abstract: For a graph G with n vertices and m edges, with ordinary spectrum lambda(i), i = 1, 2,..., n, and with Laplacian spectrum mu(i), i = 1, 2, ..., n, the energy and the Laplacian energy are n n defined as E(G) = (n)Sigma(i=1) vertical bar lambda(i)vertical bar and LE(G) = (n)Sigma(i=1) vertical bar mu(i) - 2m/n vertical bar respectively. It is known that E(G) = LE(G) if G is regular. We now show that there axe non-regular graphs with the same property. We provide numerous examples for the inequality E(G) <= LE(G) and conjecture that it holds for all graphs.
paper_title: Relation between energy and Laplacian energy
